description: ERECTION OF A PART SINGLE PART 2 STOREY REAR ADDITION, RAISED PLATFORM, SIDE DORMER AND REAR DORMER
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: AMIN/PLAN/003; AMIN/PLAN/004; AMIN/PLAN/005/REV-A; AMIN/PLAN/002/REV-A; 2020/004/04

Condition : 3 - Matching Materials - The facing materials used in the development hereby permitted shall match those of the existing building in materials, style, colour, texture and, in the case of brickwork, bonding, coursing and pointing.

Condition : 4 - Obscured Glazing (Fixed Shut) - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the windows in the dormer side dormer on the flank elevation shall be glazed with obscure glass and fixed shut below 1.7m and shall permanently maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 5 - The development hereby approved shall implement the flood mitigation measures as submitted with the proposal titled: EA FRA Matrix. These measures shall thereafter be retained in perpetuity.
REASON: To reduce the risk of flooding and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy SI 13 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS16 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policy DM F2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 6 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant was offered the opportunity to submit amended plans in order to make the proposal acceptable in planning terms.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
